title: 2022 Vegetable School - Intro to High Tunnel Vegetable Production

tasks.task: Participate in a high-tunnel vegetable production discussion by an Extension Vegetable Specialist.
subtasks: Listen to the Extension Vegetable Specialist's introduction and acknowledge their role.
Understand the benefits of high-tunnel production for small growers and home gardeners.
Recognize the challenges and solutions for heater tunnel pest management.
Learn about optimizing planting dates to extend the growing season.
Consider the role of irrigation and soil management in high-tunnel production.
Research suitable high-value crops for high-tunnel production.
Explore the importance of crop rotation and diversified planting schedules.
Seek information on the Extension's high tunnel crop production handbook.

tasks.task: Engage in the planning and implementation of a high-tunnel vegetable production system.
subtasks: Determine the appropriate size and structure of the high tunnel for personal needs.
Research and plan for the construction or purchase of a high tunnel.
Develop a planting schedule that takes into account optimal growing seasons and weather risks.
Select high-value crops suitable for high-tunnel production and research their specific care requirements.
Set up a effective irrigation system, considering drip or mulch film options.
Implement soil management practices, including compost and manure applications.
Develop a crop rotation and pest management strategy to minimize disease and infestations.
Consider organic certification for potential premium prices.
Plan marketing strategies to capitalize on off-season crops and premium produce.
